event.title: was carved from Cherokee County territory during the Georgia Land Lottery of 1832

data.event: Union County was carved from Cherokee County territory during the Georgia Land Lottery of 1832.
Since the county was founded almost 30 years before the U.S. Civil War, Union County obviously was not named in sympathy for the North, as is sometimes thought.

event.title: the war, as was true of much of Georgia's mountainous north, and the county's delegates to the state convention of 1861

data.event: County residents, however, were largely pro-Union in the years leading up to the war, as was true of much of Georgia's mountainous north, and the county's delegates to the state convention of 1861 voted against secession.
